snippet.title: Battle Chess (3DO): Red vs. Blue
snippet.description:
Battle Chess (3DO): Me (Red) vs. CPU (Blue)

Battle Chess is a video game version of chess in which the chess pieces come to life and battle one another when capturing.  It was originally developed and released by Interplay Entertainment for the Amiga in 1988 and subsequently on many other systems, including 3DO, Commodore 64, DOS, NES, and Windows.  The game can be also played in a 2D version with no animations, and it could be played against a human opponent or against the computer's artificial intelligence.

Battle Chess (c) Interplay
